remarks: For a given interpretation of the variables ` G ` and of the scalars ` F ` , this extends to a homomorphic interpretation of the polynomial ring in exactly one way.  (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 9-Mar-2015.)
statement:
evlseu.p $e |- P = ( I mPoly R ) $.
evlseu.c $e |- C = ( Base ` S ) $.
evlseu.a $e |- A = ( algSc ` P ) $.
evlseu.v $e |- V = ( I mVar R ) $.
evlseu.i $e |- ( ph -> I e. _V ) $.
evlseu.r $e |- ( ph -> R e. CRing ) $.
evlseu.s $e |- ( ph -> S e. CRing ) $.
evlseu.f $e |- ( ph -> F e. ( R RingHom S ) ) $.
evlseu.g $e |- ( ph -> G : I --> C ) $.
evlseu $p |- ( ph -> E! m e. ( P RingHom S ) ( ( m o. A ) = F /\ ( m o. V ) = G ) ) $.
$d A m $.
$d F m $.
